docs.title: Andes Studio
docs.text: Andes Studio is a Visual Studio Code extension that provides an integrated development environment for Andes software development. It allows developers to build, debug, and analyze applications directly in VS Code, without manually installing or managing individual toolchains.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Demo Applications
docs.text: The included demo applications introduce how to build and configuration projects, and run it.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Operating System: Windows, Linux
  • Software: Visual Studio Code (version 1.82 or later)

docs.title: Installing Andes Studio
docs.text: Install VSCode Download the latest version of Visual Studio Code from the official website: https://code.visualstudio.com/download

docs.title: References
docs.text: See Andes Programming Guide for the use of compiler/linker/assembler options.
